channel.title: Posts on Jincheng Li
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Jincheng Li

item.title: Computer Architecture 101
item.description: This is the first in a series of posts about the inner workings of Linux, partially inspired by linux-insides. I’m starting with a review of basic computer architecture. I find it easy to lose track of the fundamental building blocks of a computer when you are operating at a higher level of abstraction. Plus I don’t think schools necessarily cover all of this in a typical CS program (or maybe they do but I wasn’t paying attention).

item.title: Enforcing Email Frequency Caps
item.description: Enough with the Spamming: Enforcing Email Frequency Caps This is something I did at work, posted to Medium. It talks about challenges involved in preventing our services from sending too many emails to the same address quickly.

item.title: PostgreSQL Query Optimization
item.description: The other day I saw a tweet about blog posts it would be great to see, and one of them was “inside PostgreSQL: how a join works internally, what makes it fast”. Coincidentally, I’m taking a course on database system implementation, and I thought this would be a great way to study for my midterm! Of course, by the time I’ve finished this post, the midterm is long gone, but it was still a great incentive for me to start writing :)

item.title: Why This Blog
item.description: I originally started this blog as a graduate student while I was at Columbia, in the hopes of putting my spare time to better use. Now it’s just a rarely updated dumping ground of half-written articles :) This site uses Hugo. The theme is Hugo Xmin.
